column2: (fml.) make sth. publicly known, esp. after it has been kept secret 透露；揭露；泄露
column3: e.g. The spokesman of the company refused to [[disclose]] more details of their latest project to the press.

column2: (old ~ ) (infml. not polite) an offensive word for an old man 老家伙；老东西
happening or existing in many places, and therefore not special or unusual 常见的；屡见不鲜的
column3: e.g. With the improvement of people's living standard, foreign travels have become [[commonplace]].

column2: [C] a thing that replaces sth, esp. because the first thing is old, broken, etc. 替代品；替换物
column3: e.g. Just two months ago, he underwent hip [[replacement]] surgery that cost $120,000.

column2: officially get rid of a law, system, practice, etc. 废止；废除；取消
column3: e.g. It was only at the very end of the 19th century that this practice was [[abolished]].

column2: stop sth. from being active, either temporarily or permanently 暂停 ; 中止
column3: e.g. We have decided to [[suspend]] all production at the factory until safety checks can be carried out.

column2: [C] sb. who believes that good things will happen 乐观者；乐观主义者
column3: e.g. He's an eternal [[optimist]]. He always expects good things to happen or things to be successful.

column2: deliberately make sth. such as a feeling or an activity last longer 延长，拉长，拖长（感觉或活动）
column3: e.g. Doctors say these new drugs can reduce pain and [[prolong]] life for two or three years.

column2: 1) (only before noun) existing now, and needing to be dealt with quickly 目前的；当下的；紧迫的
column3: e.g. Let's try and solve the most [[immediate]] problems before they get worse.；e.g. If the eyes are affected by the drug, you must seek [[immediate]] medical attention.

column2: 2) happening or done at once and without delay 立刻的；即刻的
column3: e.g. Let's try and solve the most [[immediate]] problems before they get worse.；e.g. If the eyes are affected by the drug, you must seek [[immediate]] medical attention.

column2: 1) difficult or impossible to afford or understand 得不到的；难懂的
column3: e.g. The language of teenagers is often completely [[inaccessible]] to the elderly.；e.g. A long flight of stairs made the center of the museum [[inaccessible]] to disabled visitors.

column2: 2) difficult or impossible to reach 难到达的 ; 不可及的
column3: e.g. The language of teenagers is often completely [[inaccessible]] to the elderly.；e.g. A long flight of stairs made the center of the museum [[inaccessible]] to disabled visitors.

column2: treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way （不公正地）区别对待，歧视
column3: e.g. Caulfield claimed the company had [[discriminated]] against him because of his nationality.

column2: [C] 鞭子
in a way that is similar to, typical of, or relates to young people 年轻地；像年轻人地；具有年轻人特点地
column3: e.g. Melania believes that dressing [[youthfully]] is about keeping up with trends.

column2: 1) strong and healthy 强健的；精力旺盛的
column3: e.g. Cutting the bush back in the autumn will help promote [[vigorous]] growth in the spring.；e.g. According to a recent survey, a quarter of people over 12 get no [[vigorous]] exercise at all.

column2: 2) using a lot of energy and strength or determination 强度大的；积极的
column3: e.g. Cutting the bush back in the autumn will help promote [[vigorous]] growth in the spring.；e.g. According to a recent survey, a quarter of people over 12 get no [[vigorous]] exercise at all.

column2: having old-fashioned attitudes and ideas — used to show disapproval 古板的，守旧的（含贬义）
column3: e.g. Tim was rude, unable to bear criticism, and more and more [[hidebound]] in his views as he got older.

column2: bring back the same feelings or qualities that you experienced in the past 使重温；使再次经历
column3: e.g. I would say the film successfully [[recaptured]] the joyful atmosphere of those days.

column2: [C] a working life in which you have several different jobs at one time, or a series of different kinds of job 组合型职业
column3: e.g. There is a trend toward more temporary employment and [[portfolio]] careers.

column2: in a way that is suitable for a particular situation or that is based on what sb. has done or said 相应地
column3: e.g. It is said that the new employee has broken the rule and will be punished [[accordingly]].

column2: [C]  sb. whose work needs physical strength, for example building work 体力劳动者；工人
column3: e.g. Matthew has worked as a [[laborer]] in factories and on construction sites since he left his hometown.

column2: [C] sb. whose job is to keep and check financial accounts, calculate taxes, etc. 会计师；会计
column3: e.g. People setting up business on their own really need to employ an [[accountant]].

column2: [C, U] the act of guessing about the possible causes or effects of sth. without knowing all the facts, or the guesses that you make 猜测；推测
column3: e.g. There has been a great deal of [[speculation]] about what will happen after the president resigns.

column2: 1) an unpleasant or difficult situation that is difficult to escape from 牢笼；困境
column3: e.g. Don't fall into the [[trap]] of investing all your money in one place.

column2: 2) （捕捉动物的）夹子，罗网，陷阱
column3: e.g. Don't fall into the [[trap]] of investing all your money in one place.

column2: continuing forever and having no end 永远的；永恒的
column3: e.g. Three teenage girls took a vow (誓言) of [[eternal]] friendship during the summer of 1985.

column2: (cause to) dry and die 枯萎；干枯
column3: e.g. It is a pity that the spring flowers were already beginning to [[wither]].

column2: [C] 蝉
warn sb. that sth. might be dangerous, difficult, etc. 警告；告诫；提醒
column3: e.g. The business report released on Wednesday [[cautioned]] investors against over-optimistic expectations.

column2: (infml.) very good, esp. in a way that makes you feel happy and excited 极好的；极棒的
column3: e.g. The actress who played the fashion designer in the movie was absolutely [[terrific]]!

column2: force sth. into a small space 把···塞进（小空间）；硬塞
column3: e.g. You have to be realistic — it's difficult to [[cram]] everything into a tight schedule.

column2: succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation （成功地）应付，对付
column3: e.g. Some parents feel that they have got to the stage where they aren't able to [[cope]] on their own.

column2: not able to live forever 不会长生不死的；终有一死的
column3: e.g. Her father's death reminded her that she was [[mortal]], and it made her very sad.

column2: [U] the state of living forever or being remembered forever 永生；长存；永恒
column3: e.g. Some people want to achieve [[immortality]] through their works.

column2: [C] sb. who often has fantasies, or who confuses fantasy and what is real 幻想家；空想家；不切实际者
column3: e.g. He is neither a liar nor a [[fantasist]], and he is careful about what he says.

column2: a list of things that you want to do before you die 人生心愿清单
column3: e.g. Traveling to the Potala Palace in Tibet has been on my [[bucket]] list for years.

column2: etc.
column3: manage to avoid death or a very bad situation even though it seemed that you would not be able to 死里逃生；逃脱厄运等
column4: e.g. Could you explain to us how you [[cheated]] death at every stage of the journey?

column2: no longer young, and therefore no longer attractive or good at doing things 不再年轻；人老珠黄
column3: e.g. Kathleen thinks she's [[over]] the [[hill]], but she's only 32.

column2: available to be bought, chosen, or used 可买到的； 供使用的；提供的
column3: e.g. Activities [[on]] [[offer]] at the beach include sailing, rowing, canoeing and camping.

column2: arriving or happening soon 即将到达（发生）
column3: e.g. Economists agree that the economic situation is good and recovery is [[on]] the [[way]].

column2: seem likely to happen 很可能发生
column3: e.g.- So you think they'll get married next year? - I think it's in the [[cards]].

column2: become damaged and useless, or make sth. like this, by using it a lot or for a long time 用坏 ;（使）磨损
column3: e.g. I bought a pair of boots three years ago and they are beginning to [[wear]] out.

column2: start a business 开业
column3: e.g. Dr. Rosen closed his downtown practice and [[set]] up [[shop]] in a suburban neighborhood.

column2: if sth. such as a quality, disease, or skill runs in the family, many people in that family have it （某种品质、疾病、技能等）在家族中遗传，是家族特征
column3: e.g. All the three kids of the Thompsons are good musicians. The musical talent seems to [[run]] in the [[family]].

column2: sb. who has the whip hand is in a good position because they can make other people do what they want 支配权；控制权
column3: e.g. During the last decade, the right wing of the party has held the [[whip]] [[hand]] over the country.

column2: make sth. more complete, esp. by adding another feature （尤指通过增加另一特点而）使更加完美，彻底完成
column3: e.g. The feedback is that more research and solid evidence are needed to [[round]] out the article.

column2: prepare a written document, such as a list or contract 起草，拟定（名单、合同等）
column3: e.g. Local authorities have [[drawn]] up guidelines on waste treatment and disposal.

column2: develop or come from sth. else 源自；源于
column3: e.g. This word is [[derived]] from Latin, meaning "water."；e.g. Medically, we will [[derive]] great benefit from the application of this technique.

column2: vt.get sth., esp. an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from sth. 得到，获得（优势或愉快的感受）
column3: e.g. This word is [[derived]] from Latin, meaning "water."；e.g. Medically, we will [[derive]] great benefit from the application of this technique.

column2: 1) make sb. feel sexually excited 激起···的性欲
column3: e.g. His strange behavior at the meeting yesterday [[aroused]] my suspicion.

column2: 2) make sb. have a particular feeling or attitude 激起（感情、态度）
column3: e.g. His strange behavior at the meeting yesterday [[aroused]] my suspicion.

column2: consisting of or relating to the cells of plants or animals 由细胞组成的；细胞的
column3: e.g. Researchers have been observing the course of the disease at the cellular level.

column2: [C] （计算机屏幕上显示准备接受指令的）提示， 提示符
column3: e.g. The computer program will [[prompt]] the user to enter data where it is required.

column2: vt.make people say or do sth. as a reaction 引起，激起（某人说或做某事）
column3: e.g. The computer program will [[prompt]] the user to enter data where it is required.

column2: 1) an instruction to a computer to do sth. 指令
column3: e.g. Check that the computer has executed the [[commands]] that you typed in.；e.g. An officer stood on one of the tanks and began shouting [[commands]] through a loudspeaker.

column2: 2) an order that should be obeyed 命令；指示
column3: e.g. Check that the computer has executed the [[commands]] that you typed in.；e.g. An officer stood on one of the tanks and began shouting [[commands]] through a loudspeaker.

column2: (fml.) sb. who receives sth. 接受者；领受者
column3: e.g. I felt glad that I was a giver of pleasure, not merely a passive [[recipient]].

column2: [U, sing.] the movement of blood around your body 血液循环
column3: e.g. Stretching is a good way to relax muscles and to increase blood [[circulation]] during long-time air travel.

column2: [U] 胰岛素
[U] 葡萄糖
[U] 睾酮
[U] 瘦蛋白
eat too much, or eat more than is healthy 吃得过多； 暴食
column3: e.g. A woman who [[overeats]] during pregnancy can cause health problems for her child.

column2: over a wide area 弥漫地；扩散地；漫射地
column3: e.g. One weakness of the essay is that the information is given diffusely instead of in a certain section, thereby reducing the effective communication of ideas.

column2: [C] 甲状腺
moving, reacting or working more slowly than normal and in a way that seems lazy 缓慢的；迟缓的；懒洋洋的
column3: e.g. The company has been rather [[sluggish]] in responding to the rapid changes in technology.

column2: (not before noun) not knowing about or not noticing sth. that is happening around you 不知道的；未察觉到的
column3: e.g. He went on and on about how successful he was, [[oblivious]] to the fact that he had hurt her.

column2: increase or improve sth. and make it more successful 促进；推动；使兴旺
column3: e.g. They won the semi-final and this [[boosted]] the morale (士气) of the team.

column2: (also adrenalin) [U] 肾上腺素
[C] （从0到9的任何一个）数字
existing or popular for only a short time 短暂的；只流行一时的
column3: e.g. Many words appearing during that period were quite [[ephemeral]] and have passed into history.

column2: make inactive 使不活动；使不活跃
column3: e.g. Researchers have identified antibodies (抗体) that [[inactivate]] the virus before it has the chance to change itself.

column2: [C] 肾；肾脏
[C, U] sb. / sth. that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern 例外；除外
column3: e.g. Few guitarists can sing as well as they can play; however, he is an [[exception]].

column2: continue to exist, be noticeable, etc. for longer than is usual or desirable 继续留存（较惯常或理想的时间长）
column3: e.g. The faint smell of her perfume [[lingered]] on in the room long after she had left.

column2: (usu. before noun) (fml.) relating to the ability to show what is going to happen in the future 预测的； 预言的；前瞻的
column3: e.g. Newton's physical theories are a good example of how a scientific theory may be [[predictive]] as well as explanatory.

column2: 1) when half a period of time has passed （一段时间）在中间的；到一半（的）
column3: e.g. She was interrupted by the chairperson when she was [[midway]] through her presentation.；e.g. We are coming close to the [[midway]] point between Los Angeles and San Francisco.

column2: 2) between two places, and the same distance from each of them 在中途（的）；在半路（的）；在中间（的）
column3: e.g. She was interrupted by the chairperson when she was [[midway]] through her presentation.；e.g. We are coming close to the [[midway]] point between Los Angeles and San Francisco.

column2: [U] a feeling of excitement about sth. enjoyable that is going to happen in the near future 期望；盼望
column3: e.g. There was a sense of [[anticipation]] in the audience as the curtain went up for the play.

column2: [U] 胃泌素；促胃液素
make sth. happen very quickly, esp. a series of events 引发，激发（尤指一系列事件）
column3: e.g. There must be specific events which [[triggered]] the aggressive displays in your dog.

column2: [C, U] 酸（一种化学物质）
[U] the process of digesting food 消化（过程）
column3: e.g. [[Digestion]] is the organic process by which food is converted into substances that can be absorbed into the body.

column2: [C] 腺
[C]  肿瘤；肿块；瘤
[U] 甲状腺功能亢进
1) sb.'s height or size 身高；身材
column3: e.g. I was by no means short in [[stature]], but next to this man I felt like a dwarf (矮子).；e.g. At that time there were no other universities in England equal in [[stature]] to Oxford and Cambridge.

column2: 2) the degree to which sb. is admired or regarded as important 名声；声望
column3: e.g. I was by no means short in [[stature]], but next to this man I felt like a dwarf (矮子).；e.g. At that time there were no other universities in England equal in [[stature]] to Oxford and Cambridge.

column2: 1) if a large amount of a liquid, electricity, chemical, etc. surges, it moves very quickly and suddenly （大量液体）汹涌；（电流）浪涌；（化学物等）突然涌动
column3: e.g. Adrenaline [[surged]] through her veins.；e.g. After the doors of the theater opened, the crowd [[surged]] forward and police had to intervene.

column2: 2) suddenly move very quickly in a particular direction 迅速涌动；蜂拥向前
column3: e.g. Adrenaline [[surged]] through her veins.；e.g. After the doors of the theater opened, the crowd [[surged]] forward and police had to intervene.

column2: 1) used for emphasizing the difference between two situations 而（用于强调两种情况之间的差异）
column3: e.g. Stress can be extremely damaging to your health. Exercise, [[meanwhile]], can reduce its effects.；e.g. The hurricane will reach the island this evening. [[Meanwhile]], residents are being evacuated (转移).

column2: 2) while sth. else is happening 与此同时
column3: e.g. Stress can be extremely damaging to your health. Exercise, [[meanwhile]], can reduce its effects.；e.g. The hurricane will reach the island this evening. [[Meanwhile]], residents are being evacuated (转移).

column2: 1) prevent sth. from growing or developing, or from working effectively 抑制（生长、发展、起作用等）
column3: e.g. It is probable that the medication will [[suppress]] the symptom without treating the condition.；e.g. Illegal cross-border transactions are very active in this area despite international attempts to [[suppress]] them.

column2: 2) stop opposition or protest using military force or strict laws （凭借武力或严格的法律）平定，制止，镇压
column3: e.g. It is probable that the medication will [[suppress]] the symptom without treating the condition.；e.g. Illegal cross-border transactions are very active in this area despite international attempts to [[suppress]] them.

column2: [U] 尿
(infml.) pass liquid waste from your body 撒尿
column3: e.g. I need to [[pee]] before I leave. It's going to be a long journey.

column2: do sth. because of another person's advice or order, or because you have received information or had an idea 根据···行事
column3: e.g. A patient will usually listen to the doctor's advice and [[act]] on it.

column2: increase the level of sth. slightly so as to bring it back to the level you want 补足；将···增加到所需之量
column3: e.g. He had to do extra jobs on the weekend to [[top]] up his income and support the family.

column2: write your final message at the end of an informal letter （写非正式信件时）收笔
column3: e.g. It's getting late, so she wrote a few more lines and [[signed]] off with "Yours, Janet."
